google_play_reviews.content: Great app! So nice to access my nextcloud cookbook seamlessly. Love the timer function!
This is so awesome üòéüòéüòé
Works but is almost unusable slow. Minutes of loading for everything. Also, data like images seem to be not being cached.
As promised by the developer a fix was issued. App is working great again! Many thanks! Best nextcloud cookbook app available! üëç
Doesn't work with Nextcloud 24. Viewing recipes throw a 405 error, and the All tab just sits there with a loading spinner.
Like the app, but it doesn't open source urls. For saved recipies
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê A+++ Great work! Thank you! I love this app ‚ù§ A must have app if you have Nextcloud. Any chance of an iOS appüôÇ The Best Privacy focused cookbook in the world! Bravo!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: There is now a iOS version available

google_play_reviews.content: Easily the best android client for Nextcloud Cookbook. I really appreciate the feature where the screen doesn't sleep when a recipe is loaded.
Love this app. Would like to see an IOS version so my wife can use it too!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the encouraging words! With a little bit of luck an IOS version might come in the not too far future! (see github if interested)

google_play_reviews.content: Love it, perfect app! Search/Filter by tags would be a nice addition.

It imports receipes quickly and easily. However, you cant add or edit. I receive ans error that says Create Failed Exception. NoSuchMethodError The method addall was called on Null. Receiver Null. Tried Calling addAll()
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your Feedback. I have just pushed a new release that should fix this issue!

google_play_reviews.content: super
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for the good Rating!

google_play_reviews.content: After Nextcloud upgrade this doesn't work correctly. I get multiple errors and no content displayed. I can still search through recipes, but categories are no longer listed. *Edit* Worked with developer and found an issue in my entries that seemed to be causing the issue. Everything working as it should.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback! Could you provide me some screen shots of the error on github nextcloud-cookbook-flutter so I can try to figure out what is wrong? | Edit: I'm happy that it worked out! Thanks for the updated review :)

google_play_reviews.content: Works great for my local-only Nextcloud instance!

I've used every Nextcloud cookbook integration app I can find and, so far, this is the only one that has worked worth a damn (one simply stalls out when loading recipes; the other insists that I *don't* have the Nextcloud Files app installed, and apparently won't work without it). So thank you for producing an app that at least *works*! That said, I can see it still has a fair bit of work ahead of it, but I look forward to it. I think there's considerable potential here. Load times are a bit slow for me, but I have that same issue with the core Cookbook app, so that might not be the fault of this app. The feature I miss most right now is the Markdown support in the recipe description; I use that extensively to provide additional data and cross-reference to other recipes/categories/etc. However, I'm sure that will be added eventually.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. I know that there are still a lot of issues. I think the markdown request is already tracked on github. I hope it will be implemented soon but I have sadly no time line!

google_play_reviews.content: Works great but lacks a planner and a shopping list maker. (Will edit the review if the features are implemented)
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for your Feedback.
As this is only a client for the cookbook plugin of nextcloud I cannot implement this feature as long as the plugin itself does not support it. You could request the feature on the github page of the plugin nextcloud-cookbook

google_play_reviews.content: Great app, simple and intuitive! What are the chances a PRINT option could be added?

Great start! Thanks for taking this on. It was getting annoying having to navigate the website for my recipes on my phone. I look forward to more functionality, but happy this exists at all right now. Thanks for your continued work, nice to be able to add recipe URLs now!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your feedback. I'm currently working on editing recipes but it is a little bit harder than i expected. If you have any request please contact me over on github.

google_play_reviews.content: Exactly what he says is implemented, works. I can't wait to see if those planned features follow through. It would be a game changer.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot for the kind words! This helps me to stay motivated! If you have any Feature Request please visit the GitHub page.

google_play_reviews.content: This is such an exciting project. Mimics the functionality of other apps but in my won self hosted Nextcloud. Will be perfect if it can add from URL within the app. Good luck with future updates.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot for the kind words! Importing Recipes form URL is definitively a feature that i will start to work on very soon! Edit: I just wanted to let you know that it is now possible to import and add new recipes from inside the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Great!! It worked immediatly!! Thanks!!
This is a very well thought out app. Cannot recommend highly enough.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot for these kind words! It helps a lot to stay motivated!

google_play_reviews.content: Looking forward to the new features. Already updated to 0.4.0 - With the new edit recipes feature but only around 50% of my recipes can be edited in this app, half of them just show a big grey box but I cannot figure out any similarities between the recipes. If the Developer needs a beta tester, I'll happily volunteer. UPDATE: Grey box appears on recipes that have missing prep/cooking/total times. If I just add in 1 minute for those values, I can edit the recipe in the app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Oh shit thanks for the info ^^ I will fix that as soon as possible! If you have more suggestions or if you want to otherwise be involved check out the github page of nextcloud-cookbook-flutter. There it is also easier to create feature requests and such! Edit: The issue with the grey boxes should be no more :)

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent product. I look forward to what will show up in the coming soon section. Thanks for all the hard work to create this tool for us.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! I uploaded a fix today which should hopefully resolve the issues around the category loading. Update: This was indeed another error that i didn't spot! I published a new version that should be available soon that will also fix this issue! I'm sorry for the inconvenience!

google_play_reviews.content: Well, that app deserves a 5/5. It works nicely, the developper answered and fixed the bug quickly (a few days), and I even had a bug for which I did not had time to explain (white icon AND white text for recipes without picture, aka : You don't see a thing) that is already fixed. the application has a green mark on Exodus Privacy, so no tracker in it whatsoever, and no ads within the app. Having that app on F-Droid would be a blast as it would allow all non-google phone users to use it. And BTW, get some donation button somewhere, you really deserve that :D Original Comment : Noted 3/5 because of bug. I can't get to the main page, error shown "category load failed: bad state : no element". I can search for a recipe but not see all of them
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! I just pushed a new version which should be available soon that should fix this problem! If not please let me know! Edit: Thanks for your kind words! BTW. The app is on F-Droid (see github main page)

google_play_reviews.content: Be nice to add recipes as well to the instance. Will this be in a future release?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for you Feedback! Indeed i'm currently working on editing recipes and then adding recipes. Although i'm currently prioritizing to fix bugs! Edit: I just wanted to let you know that it is now possible to add new recipes from inside the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Exactly what I need, thanks! However, after upgrading the nextcloud cookbook app today I started getting an error message on the categories screen "Category load failed: FormatException: Unexpected character (at character 1) Edit: Thanks for the reply! A fix would be great, looking forward to it. Must say again, even though import and edit would be very nice to have in this app, simply a viewer app for cookbook on the phone is brilliant when cooking, Nice work!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your nice feedback! There is indeed a problem with the new version of the plugin on nextcloud. The api changed and I will need to take this into account. I hope I have a fix for this till the end of the week! Edit: I am working on editing but it's not as easy as I hoped! Maybe this month? (fingers crossed ü§û) Edit: Should be fixed now!

google_play_reviews.content: Cool app to show the nextcloud cookbook on Android. Also cool that the App directly syncs with the nextcloud instance and not via a local directory! That's great. I would like to have an advanced search, where also my keywords for each recipe are used. Atm only the recipe name is used, and my attached Keywords aren't used for the search. That would be a cool feature. Would also be cool to create recipes via the app, in the same way as one can do it via the URL import. That would be cool. Don't know how much effort, and I also would say its a "nice-to-have" feature. Me and my girlfriend were looking for a way to store and order our recipes besides sharing and searching them in Whatsapp. W e will start with your app and the Nextcloud Cookbook and see how this works out. Therefore: Thank you for your app! and please be motivated and keep going, I think this is pretty cool. Big shoutout and motivation to you.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank a lot for you motivating feedback :D it definitively worked! The idea with search by keywords is a good idea an i can check if it is possible to squeeze that into some random update. Edit: I just wanted to let you know that it is now possible to add new recipes from inside the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Seems like it'd be exactly what I need, but with 2FA enabled it doesn't seem to want to allow me to log in. When inputting a freshly generated app password, I get error 403 Forbidden. Logs state that host was not connected because it violates local access rules, though my setup is pretty fresh and ordinary. Issue still occurs after allowing local remote servers through occ command, though it now doesn't throw the local access server error now. Devices & sessions shows it logs in, but it doesn't.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hello. You are absolutely correct. Currently it is not possible to login when 2FA is enabled. The app tries to create its own app password which is not possible with the 2FA. For the next version i will add an option that you can provide your own AppPassword which should then fix your problem!
Update: Version 0.3.5 should now enable 2FA login!
